key_title: Key to the species of Lycium

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Solanaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla 8–12 mm long; leaves usually less than 5 times as long as wide
Corolla 15–20 mm long; leaves at least 5 times as long as wide
Corolla-lobes one-third to half the length of corolla; stamens much exserted; leaves slightly fleshy, at least some more than 5 mm wide
Corolla-lobes about a quarter the length of corolla; stamens included or scarcely exserted; leaves thick and fleshy, usually 1.5–5 mm wide
Lateral branches mostly shorter than 10 mm, leafless, ending in a spine or not; leaves mostly ovate; berry more or less ellipsoid
Lateral branches mostly longer than 10 mm, leafy, ending in a spine; leaves mostly obovate; berry more or less globose
